location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed on paperDimensions: 183 x 306mm, on sheet 244 x 477mm

mods.abstract: The map shows a British cable station at Cape Jashk on the coast of south-eastern Persia, indicating principal buildings, wells, water tanks, the routes of a land telegraph and undersea cables, hydrology and topography.The map is Plate 1 in 'Persian Gulf and Gulf of Oman' (Naval Intelligence Department No. 694), 1903, and was compiled 'From a sketch made by Commander Thomas Webster Kemp, Royal Navy, Jan. 1903.'.A printing statement reads, 'Weller & Graham, Ltd. Litho, London.'.
